title: SB 1.18.13 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 03-04-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chaksharunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: The value of a moment's association with the devotee of the Lord cannot even be compared to the attainment of heavenly planets, or liberation from matter.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and emphasizes the importance of Srimad Bhagavatam verse 1.18.13, highlighting the incomparable value of associating with pure devotees over material achievements or liberation.

segments.key_quote: You cannot compare the immense benefit you get by moments association with a pure devotee you cannot compare that with the benefit of performing so many fructive activities to elevate oneself to heavenly planets or so many more fructive activities to actually get different kinds of material riches material benefits or even some kind of fructive activity for getting liberation from material bondage
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the verse, explaining that even a fraction of a second spent in the association of a pure devotee is more valuable than any material gain or impersonal liberation.

segments.key_quote: One cannot compare the association of a pure devotee to anything material...the result of either of these is material happiness and the result of association with pure devotee is transcendental pleasure
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Srila Prabhupada's purport, contrasting material happiness derived from fruitive activities and impersonal liberation with the transcendental pleasure gained from associating with pure devotees.

segments.key_quote: The pure devotees of the Lord do not aspire after the happiness obtained in heavenly kingdom nor do they aspire after the liberation from material bondage pure devotees don't want this
segments.summary: The speaker explains that pure devotees do not desire material enjoyment or impersonal liberation, as they find the pleasures of heavenly planets to be illusory and mundane.

segments.key_quote: The devotees they are already by devotional service pure devotional service they're already liberated from all material conceptions of pleasure and distress they are liberated even while living in the material world the pure devotees they're already liberated so why will they seek liberation while they want liberation they're already liberated
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that pure devotees are already liberated through devotional service, even while living in the material world, and are engaged in a transcendental existence.

segments.key_quote: Devotional service is eternal...All these positions are finished with the body. When death comes, finished, over.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the eternal nature of devotional service with the temporary nature of material achievements, such as kingship or residence in heavenly planets, which end with the death of the body.

segments.key_quote: All material pleasures have a beginning and end. Spiritual happiness, no beginning, no end.
segments.summary: The speaker reinforces the concept of the eternality of pure devotional service and the continuous, unbroken happiness experienced by those engaged in it, contrasting it with the temporary nature of material pleasures.

segments.key_quote: For eternal life, they are useless.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of Suta Goswami speaking to the sages of Naimisharanya to illustrate that fruitive activities and Vedic study are useless for attaining eternal life compared to hearing and reciting the Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: Simply get association of a pure devotee.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the negative effects of material entanglement and sense gratification with the positive benefits of Bhagavata Sangam, or association with the Lord's name, form, qualities, activities, and pure devotees.

segments.key_quote: And that association can guarantee you eternal life.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing that Srila Prabhupada's teachings and recordings provide an opportunity for association that can guarantee eternal life.
